rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Possible Winlogon outbound connections on uncommon ports with proxy activity suggesting C2 communication.
rule.info: 106063 - OAT: Unusual Outbound Winlogon Connection on Non-Standard Port. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: An endpoint making unusual SSH connections, possibly used for data exfiltration.
rule.info: 106248 - OAT: Outbound SSH Connections. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Possible Suspicious RDP Connection Attempts via Proxy.
rule.info: 106272 - OAT: Suspicious outbound RDP connections detected. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected malicious activity phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other malicious behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Netstat links proxy activity to detect possible lateral movement.
rule.info: 106281 - OAT: network connections using the netstat command. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation:Multiple Postman proxy requests suggest potential C2 or API exploitation.
rule.info: 106391 - OAT: Multiple Suspicious Outbound Connections using Postman. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Insecure NFS mount detected via proxy, potentially exposing sensitive data to unauthorized access
rule.info: 106378 - OAT: Command to Mount NFS Insecurely. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Suspicious outbound connection from an Office app to an unknown domain/IP via proxy, suggesting potential data exfiltration
rule.info: 106190 - OAT: Suspicious Connection to Domain/IP from Microsoft Office. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Possible brute force or unauthorized RDP access detected from a suspicious domain.
rule.info: 106273 - OAT: Repeated Suspicious outbound RDP connections detected. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Repeated use of Putty for outbound SSH connections suggests potential C2 activity and data exfiltration
rule.info: 106137 - OAT: Multiple Outbound Connection using Putty. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Curl file upload to a suspicious C2 domain detected, suggesting potential data exfiltration or malicious activity.
rule.info: 106158 - OAT: Upload File to External Website via Curl. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Outgoing FTP communication to a suspicious C2 domain detected, indicating possible unauthorized data transfer or exfiltration attempts.
rule.info: 106475 - OAT: Outgoing FTP communication. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Endpoint mounted an SMB share from an external IP/domain via proxy, suggesting unauthorized access
rule.info: 106623 - OAT: Lateral Movement Through Exploit via SMB Protocol. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Outbound SMTP traffic to a suspicious C2 domain via proxy detected, suggesting potential unauthorized communication or data exfiltration.
rule.info: 106380 - OAT: Outgoing SMTP communication. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Public-Facing Application Exploitation Enabling Command-and-Control Communication.
rule.info: 106477 - OAT: Exploit Public-Facing Application leads to Command-and-Control communication. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Execution of multiple suspicious files via MSHTA routed through a proxy, connecting to a possible suspicious domain/IP.
rule.info: 106452 - OAT: Suspicious execution of Multiple executable files through MSHTA. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Possible Malware Identified on Endpoint with Communication Routed Through Proxy.
rule.info: 106609 - OAT: Malware Detection found in an endpoint. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Detect Possible Suspicious Script Dropped in Startup Folder with Outbound Proxy Communication
rule.info: 106075 - OAT: Potentially Suspicious Script Detected and Executed in Startup Folder. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Suspicious VBScript download and execution with outbound proxy communication detected.
rule.info: 106068 - OAT: Potential Suspicious Activity: VB Script Download and Execution. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Netcat Listener on Port 80 with Suspicious User Enumeration via Proxy.
rule.info: 106570 - OAT: Suspicious Activity: Netcat Listener on Port 80 and User Discovery. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Potential Execution of PowerView.ps1 from Temp folder with outbound suspicious C2 communication detected.
rule.info: 106576 - OAT: PowerView.ps1 Download and Execution from Temp Folder. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Automated Collection of Office Files via PowerShell with Outbound Proxy Communication.
rule.info: 106734 - OAT: Possible Automated Collection Of Office Files Via Powershell. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Potential Malware Collaboration Over Common Protocol Through Proxy Communication.
rule.info: 106602 - OAT: Malware Accomplice Connection Using Common Protocol. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Possible Malware Activity with Proxy-Based Outbound Communication.
rule.info: 106606 - OAT: Malware Detection. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Spearphishing Link Identified by RetroScan with Proxy Outbound Communication.
rule.info: 106610 - OAT: Spearphishing Link Addressed by RetroScan. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: File with Malicious URL Uploaded to Collaboration Platform via Proxy Communication.
rule.info: 106614 - OAT: Account Attempted to Upload File Containing Malicious URL to Collaboration Application. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation: Detection of Dangerous Web Reputation Services Access by Non-Browser Application via Proxy Communication.
rule.info: 106681 - OAT: Dangerous Web Reputation Services Detection On Non Browser Application. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: Cross-Correlation:Multiple suspicious VBScript executions from the user's download path with proxy-based communication to a suspicious domain/IP detected.
rule.info: 106066 - OAT: Multiple Suspicious VB Script Execution from User's Download Path. Zscaler-Proxy - Detected potential suspicious activity - phishing, botnet C2, spyware, or other harmful network behavior.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Meterpreter and firewall anomaly detection.
rule.info: 106768: OAT: Potential Meterpreter file system activity detection. 106765: OAT: Meterpreter credential access detection. 106762: OAT: Potential Meterpreter network activity detection. 106769: OAT: Meterpreter process injection detection. 111834: Fortigate: Detects suspicious network connections. Description: This rule detects suspicious activities indicating the potential presence of keyloggers, such as the capture of keystrokes or screenshots by processes like explorer.exe or svchost.exe.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Meterpreter and firewall anomaly detection.
rule.info: 117313: WIN: Potential Meterpreter file system activity detection. 117310: WIN: Meterpreter credential access detection. 117307: WIN: Potential Meterpreter network activity detection. 117304: WIN: Meterpreter process injection detection. 111834: Fortigate: Detects suspicious network connections. Description: This rule detects suspicious activities indicating the potential presence of keyloggers, such as the capture of keystrokes or screenshots by processes like explorer.exe or svchost.exe.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Suspicious file upload followed by large data transfer or exfiltration.
rule.info: 102728: MSO365: Executable Upload event detected in Office 365. 100951: Zscaler-proxy: Detects outbound data uploads exceeding 20MB. Description: This detection identifies suspicious file uploads in Office 365, followed by potential large data transfers or exfiltration via Zscaler. Such activity may indicate compromised credentials or malicious insider behavior, as attackers often leverage cloud services to upload sensitive files and use secure gateways like Zscaler for data exfiltration. The detection focuses on abnormal patterns, such as unusual file sizes, upload frequency, or access from unexpected locations/devices, combined with significant outbound data traffic.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Multiple location VPN login and unusual process execution.
rule.info: 100803: Event indicating multiple location VPN login activity. 106586: OAT: Unusual process execution detected. Description: This rule is triggered when a user logs into the VPN from multiple geographic locations or IP addresses within a short time window, followed by the detection of unusual or suspicious process executions on the system. The combination of these events suggests a potential security incident, such as an account takeover or unauthorized access.

rule.description: cross-correlation: FortiGate unit blocked a file due to virus and malware detection.
rule.info: 106507: OAT: Malware Detection. 111689: Fortigate: FortiGate unit blocked a file because it contains a virus. Description: This alert indicates that a FortiGate unit has blocked a file containing malware or viruses. Such files may be delivered through email attachments or malicious links. The email may exploit vulnerabilities or trick users into executing harmful payloads, leading to system compromise, data theft, or network infiltration. Immediate investigation is required to identify the source, isolate affected systems, and prevent further spread.

rule.description: cross-correlation: SSL VPN login failed followed by potential Kerberos brute-force on Active Directory accounts.
rule.info: 111595: Fortigate: Multiple SSL VPN login failures. 106657: OAT: Possible Bruteforce on Active Directory Accounts via Kerberos. Description: This correlation rule identifies an SSL VPN login failure immediately followed by a potential Kerberos brute-force attack on Active Directory accounts. This activity indicates a possible coordinated attempt to gain unauthorized access to the network using compromised credentials.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Potential phishing campaign detected with multiple malicious indicators.
rule.info: 102695: MSO365: Suspicious Exchange Inbox Rules Detected in Email Content. 102712: MSO365: Executable Upload event detected in Office 365. 106637: OAT: Email Subject Similar to Known Phishing Email Subjects. Description: This correlation rule identifies a sophisticated phishing campaign targeting Office 365 users through multiple vectors: creation of suspicious Exchange inbox rules, malicious executable file uploads, and known phishing email patterns. This sequence of events indicates a coordinated attack attempting to establish persistence and potentially distribute malware through email channels.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Firewall configuration changes followed by privilege escalation attempt detected.
rule.info: 111662: FortiGate: Firewall configuration changed. 106646: OAT: Identified Privilege Escalation Attempt. Description: This correlation rule detects potential privilege escalation attacks that are preceded by firewall configuration changes. This sequence of events may indicate an attacker attempting to modify security controls before escalating privileges, suggesting a sophisticated attempt to gain elevated access while evading detection.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Administrative access followed by suspicious account behavior detected.
rule.info: 111507: Fortigate: Multiple administrator authentication failure followed by successful login from same user. 106630: OAT: Creation or Modification of Task Scheduler Entries. Description: This correlation rule identifies potentially compromised administrator accounts by detecting successful administrative logins followed by suspicious account activities. This pattern may indicate an attacker has gained administrative access and is performing reconnaissance or attempting to establish persistence.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Remote access session followed by suspicious credential access detected.
rule.info: 111595: Fortigate: Multiple SSL VPN login failures. 106657: OAT: Possible Bruteforce on Active Directory Accounts via Kerberos. Description: This correlation rule identifies potential data theft attempts by detecting RDP sessions followed by credential access activities. This sequence of events may indicate an attacker attempting to gather credentials after gaining remote access, potentially for lateral movement or privilege escalation purposes.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Monitor for connections to known malicious domains.
rule.info: 100495: Sophos: Possible Suspicious Outbound Connection to Known Malicious Domain. 100986: Zscaler-Proxy: Possible Suspicious Outbound Connection to Known Malicious Domain. Description: This alert monitors for connections to known malicious domains, as identified by Sophos and Zscaler Proxy. Such activity is often indicative of compromised systems being used for command-and-control (C2), data exfiltration, or other malicious purposes. It correlates outbound connections flagged by different security systems to identify potential threats.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Host connection and service installation detected.
rule.info: 111677: FortiGate: Host Connection and Service Installation. 104553: AD: Windows service installation. Description: This correlation rule detects host connection activities followed by service installation. Such activities may indicate the setup of new services or applications, potentially part of a legitimate process or a malicious attempt to establish a foothold in the network. It includes configuring network settings, validating compatibility, and ensuring successful installation and connectivity.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Potential APT "admin@338" detected.
rule.info: 106775: OAT: Suspicious command execution with file redirection detected. zscaler-soar: Zscaler-Proxy group of categorized rules. Description: This correlation rule identifies potential activity associated with the APT "admin@338" by detecting unusual command execution with file redirection combined with suspicious outbound network activity. These patterns indicate possible malicious actions, including reconnaissance, data exfiltration, or command-and-control (C2) communication.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Detection of anomalous activity and domain account creation in directory services
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106083: OAT: Identified Creation Of Domain Account In Active Directory Description: This rule identifies potential security threats by combining insights from two sources: TripWire and OAT. It detects unauthorized or anomalous activities involving directory services and file operations, alongside the creation of new domain accounts in Active Directory. Such activities may indicate malicious behavior, such as unauthorized changes to critical resources or the addition of accounts potentially used for lateral movement or privilege escalation.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory service activity and anomalous account creation detection
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106086: OAT: High Number of User Windows Account Created Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activities in directory services, such as unexpected changes or access to files, which may indicate potential misuse or compromise. Additionally, it detects a high number of Windows user accounts being created within a short period. Such behavior may signify unauthorized administrative actions or attempts to expand access within the environment.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with anomalous user creation and login failures
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106087: OAT: User Creation and Login failure Event. Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous activities within directory services and files as flagged by TripWire, in conjunction with suspicious user behaviors such as unauthorized account creation and repeated login failures as reported by OAT. These combined events may indicate an attacker attempting to manipulate system configurations or gain unauthorized access.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with potential privilege escalation via sudo su
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106088: OAT: Possible Privilege Escalation using sudo su Description: This rule combines the detection of unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity identified by TripWire with potential privilege escalation attempts using 'sudo su' commands as flagged by OAT. The correlation of these activities may indicate an attacker attempting to elevate privileges while making unauthorized modifications to critical system assets.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with wmi-based user enumeration for targeted reconnaissance
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106090: OAT: WMI-based User Enumeration for Targeted Reconnaissance Description: This rule detects unauthorized directory and file activity flagged by TripWire in combination with wmi-based user enumeration attempts for targeted reconnaissance, as identified by OAT. These activities may indicate an attacker conducting reconnaissance to gather user information while attempting unauthorized changes to system configurations.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with third-party printer driver/config execution
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106091: OAT: WMI-based User Enumeration for Targeted Reconnaissance Description: This rule detects unauthorized directory and file activity flagged by TripWire in combination with wmi-based user enumeration attempts for targeted reconnaissance, as identified by OAT. These activities may indicate an attacker conducting reconnaissance to gather user information while attempting unauthorized changes to system configurations.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with amsi detection of suspicious PowerShell parameters
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106093: OAT: AMSI Detection of Suspicious PowerShell Parameters Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous directory and file activity identified by TripWire, correlated with AMSI detection of suspicious PowerShell parameters flagged by OAT. Such events may indicate an attacker using malicious PowerShell scripts to execute commands or compromise system integrity.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with suspicious powershell parameters execution
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106094: OAT: Suspicious PowerShell Parameters Execution Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity within directory services and files as flagged by TripWire, alongside the execution of suspicious PowerShell commands with unusual parameters detected by OAT. These combined behaviors may signify an attacker attempting to manipulate system configurations or execute malicious scripts.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with network share removal using net utility
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106097: OAT: Network Share Removal Using NET Utility Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity across directory services and files flagged by TripWire, combined with the detection of network share removal attempts using the net utility as reported by OAT. This activity may indicate potential attempts to disrupt access to shared resources or conceal unauthorized actions.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with file enumeration attempt followed by access to sensitive unix files
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106102: OAT: File enumeration attempt followed by access to sensitive unix files. Description: This rule correlates unauthorized and anomalous activity in directory services and files detected by TripWire with attempts to enumerate files followed by access to sensitive Unix files, as reported by OAT. Such actions may indicate an adversary seeking to gather information or compromise critical assets.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with attempt to read unix password file detection
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106103: OAT: Attempt to Read Unix Password File Detection Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity within directory services and files, as flagged by TripWire, combined with attempts to read the Unix password file, detected by OAT. These activities may signify a potential breach or malicious reconnaissance targeting sensitive authentication data.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with detection of user account added in admin group
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106536: OAT: Detection of user account added in admin group Description: This rule combines the detection of unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity identified by TripWire with events where a user account is added to an admin group as flagged by OAT. These correlated activities may indicate unauthorized privilege elevation or malicious attempts to gain administrative control.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with detection of user account removed in admin group
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106537: OAT: Detection of user account removed in admin group Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity flagged by TripWire, combined with the removal of user accounts from the admin group as reported by OAT. These activities may indicate an attempt to modify administrative privileges or disrupt authorized access.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with audit policy change
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106542: OAT: Audit Policy change Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity in directory services and files as flagged by TripWire, combined with audit policy changes detected by OAT. Such activities may indicate an attempt to tamper with security logging or evade detection while performing unauthorized actions.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with unix - users creation event detected
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106550: OAT: Unix - Users Creation Event Detected Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activities flagged by TripWire, combined with user creation events detected on Unix systems by OAT. This correlation may indicate attempts to create backdoor accounts or unauthorized access to critical assets.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with multiple users deletion event detected - linux
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106573: OAT: Multiple Users Deletion Event Detected - Linux Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity within directory services and files detected by TripWire, correlated with multiple user deletion events on Linux systems as flagged by OAT. The combination of these events may indicate malicious intent to disrupt user accounts or hide traces of unauthorized access.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with unix - users group created event detected
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106552: OAT: Unix - Users Group Created Event Detected Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous directory and file activity flagged by TripWire, combined with the detection of a users group creation event in Unix systems as reported by OAT. Such activity could indicate an attacker attempting to modify user permissions or create unauthorized groups to facilitate lateral movement or privilege escalation.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with unix - users group deleted event detected
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106553: OAT: Unix - Users Group Deleted event detected Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous activities within directory services and files as identified by TripWire, alongside the deletion of user groups in Unix systems flagged by OAT. These activities, when correlated, could indicate malicious attempts to disrupt system integrity or remove critical access controls.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with unix - adding users to the group root
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106558: OAT: Unix - Adding users to the group root Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity across directory services and files detected by TripWire, along with attempts to add users to the 'root' group on Unix systems as flagged by OAT. This combination of activities may signify malicious intent, such as privilege escalation or unauthorized access to critical system resources.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with system information discovery via iis - webshell command
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106561: OAT: System Information Discovery via IIS - WebShell Command Description: This rule combines the detection of unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity identified by TripWire with system information discovery attempts through IIS using WebShell commands, as flagged by OAT. These activities may indicate an attacker leveraging WebShells for reconnaissance and unauthorized access to sensitive system information.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with disabling linux system firewall via selinux
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106565: OAT: Disabling Linux System Firewall via SElinux. Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity across directory services and files detected by TripWire, combined with attempts to disable the Linux system firewall through SElinux as flagged by OAT. These activities may indicate malicious intent to weaken system defenses while tampering with critical files or configurations.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with attempts to disable or modify security tools for detection avoidance
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106567: OAT: Detection avoidance by Impair Defenses(Disable or Modify Tools) Description: This rule correlates unauthorized and anomalous activities in directory services and files detected by TripWire with attempts to disable or modify security tools as reported by OAT. These behaviors suggest an attacker trying to evade detection and compromise system defenses.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with network sniffing via pktmon.exe
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106571: OAT: Network Sniffing via PktMon.exe Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous activity within directory services and files as flagged by TripWire, combined with indications of network sniffing attempts using pktmon.exe as reported by OAT. The correlation of these events suggests potential reconnaissance or data exfiltration activities.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with multiple instances of potentially unauthorized copying of sensitive files
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106572: OAT: Multiple instances of potentially unauthorized copying of sensitive files Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous activity within directory services and files identified by TripWire, correlated with multiple instances of potentially unauthorized copying of sensitive files as flagged by OAT. This behavior may indicate attempts to exfiltrate sensitive information or compromise data integrity.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with lsass extraction via minidump module and 7zip compression detection
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106579: OAT: LSASS Extraction via Minidump Module and 7zip Compression Detection. Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity within directory services and files flagged by TripWire, combined with suspicious behaviors indicating LSASS credential extraction using the Minidump module followed by 7zip compression as detected by OAT. These correlated activities suggest attempts to steal credentials and exfiltrate sensitive data.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with deletion of event logs using wevutil command
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106582: OAT: Delete Event logs using wevutil command Description: This rule correlates unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity detected by TripWire with the deletion of event logs using the 'wevutil' command as flagged by OAT. Such behavior may indicate an attempt to cover tracks after unauthorized modifications or access.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with unusual process execution detected
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106586: OAT: Unusual process execution detected Description: This rule correlates unauthorized and anomalous activity across directory services and files, detected by TripWire, with unusual process executions flagged by OAT. Such events may indicate malicious behavior, such as exploitation attempts or unauthorized system modifications.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with possible malware download via http protocol
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106601: OAT: Possible Malware Download via HTTP Protocol Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous activity across directory services and files detected by TripWire, combined with potential malware download attempts via the HTTP protocol flagged by OAT. Such activities may indicate an attacker attempting to compromise systems by introducing malicious payloads while manipulating critical assets.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with malware accomplice connection using common protocol
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106602: OAT: Malware Accomplice Connection Using Common Protocol Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity flagged by TripWire, combined with potential malware accomplice connections using common protocols as detected by OAT. These correlated activities may indicate an attacker leveraging malicious tools or establishing unauthorized connections to compromise the system.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with possible http header ognl expression exploit
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106603: OAT: Possible HTTP Header OGNL Expression Exploit Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity flagged by TripWire alongside potential http header ognl expression exploits identified by OAT. Such a combination of events may indicate attempts to exploit application vulnerabilities while modifying critical system files or directories.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with file detection for webshell - outbound
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106604: OAT: File Detection for Webshell - Outbound Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity identified by TripWire, combined with the detection of potential webshell-related files with outbound communication flagged by OAT. Such activities may indicate the presence of malicious scripts used for unauthorized access or data exfiltration.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with remote code execution via HTTP
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106605: OAT: Remote Code Execution via HTTP Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activities detected by TripWire, combined with potential remote code execution attempts via HTTP as flagged by OAT. The correlation of these events may suggest an attacker exploiting vulnerabilities to execute unauthorized code and manipulate critical system resources.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with malware detection
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106606: OAT: Malware Detection Description: This rule identifies unauthorized and anomalous directory service and file activity flagged by TripWire in conjunction with malware detection events reported by OAT. The combination of these indicators suggests potential malicious activities targeting critical system components.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with malware detection found in an endpoint
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106609: OAT: Malware Detection found in an endpoint. Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous activities in directory services and files flagged by TripWire, combined with malware detection events on endpoints as identified by OAT. The conjunction of these alerts suggests potential malicious behavior, such as system compromise or unauthorized access attempts.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Unauthorized directory and file activity with detection of processhacker powertool
rule.info: fimoat: Tripwire: Unauthorized and Anomalous Activity Detection Across Directory Services and Files 106608: OAT: File Detection for ProcessHacker PowerTool Description: This rule detects unauthorized and anomalous activity across directory services and files identified by TripWire, along with the presence of ProcessHacker PowerTool as flagged by OAT. Such tools are often used by attackers for unauthorized system exploration and process manipulation.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Ransomware activity detection.
rule.info: 106692: OAT: Abnormal file encryption activity detected. 100986: Zscaler-Proxy: Possible Suspicious Outbound Connection to Known Malicious Domain. Description: Multiple ransomware indicators have been detected originating from the same endpoint, suggesting a potential ongoing attack.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Privileged account misuse and suspicious data transfers.
rule.info: 110575: CyberArk-Vault: Privileged Command executed. Description: multiple related events matched predefined conditions. For example, unusual privileged account activity combined with abnormal data transfers suggests potential misuse or a data breach attempt.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Host connection and service installation detected.
rule.info: Description: The "Host Connection and Service Installation" alert is triggered when a system connects to a host and initiates the installation of a service or application. This can indicate potential unauthorized software installation or lateral movement within the network, often associated with malware or suspicious activity. The alert is designed to detect abnormal service installation behavior on hosts.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Network attack signature followed by suspicious tool transfer activity.
rule.info: 111600: Fortigate: Attack detected by UDP/TCP signature. 106651: OAT: Ingress Tool Transfer. Description: This correlation rule identifies potential Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) activity by detecting a sequence of events starting with network-based attacks followed by tool transfer attempts. This pattern suggests an adversary may have successfully breached initial defenses and is attempting to transfer additional tools for expanding their foothold in the network.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Network attack followed by web server exploitation attempt detected.
rule.info: 111808: Fortigate: Directory traversal exploitation attempt identified. 106640: OAT: Identified Attempts To Exploit HTTP Server Directory Traversal Vulnerability. Description: This correlation rule identifies a sequence of events where a signature-based attack is followed by directory traversal attempts on a web server. This pattern may indicate a multi-stage attack attempting to compromise web services after initial probing attacks.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Network service disruption with unexpected system activity detected.
rule.info: 111788: Fortigate: IPsec DPD failed. 106713: OAT: Unusual App Audit Activity. Description: This correlation rule identifies a sequence where VPN connectivity failures are followed by unusual application activity. This pattern could indicate attempts to exploit application services during network disruptions.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Automated vulnerability assessment tool detected preceding malicious service manipulation attempt
rule.info: 111838: Fortigate: ZGrab scanning tool activity identified. 106649: OAT: Identified Zgrab Scanner Traffic. Description: This correlation rule identifies systematic scanning activity detected by multiple security controls. This indicates persistent reconnaissance attempts using automated tools, suggesting coordinated network enumeration efforts.

rule.description: cross-correlation: PowerShell activity followed by command shell execution detected.
rule.info: 106644: OAT: Identified Microsoft PowerShell Command Execution. 111809: Fortigate: Command interpreter execution pattern observed. Description: This correlation rule identifies a sequence of PowerShell command execution followed by shell command activities. This pattern could indicate potential command chain execution or script-based attack attempts.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Potential persistence and removable media activity detected.
rule.info: 104583: The system recognized a new external device. 106630: OAT: Creation or Modification of Task Scheduler Entries. Description: This correlation rule detects possible data exfiltration or malware persistence attempts by identifying scheduled task modifications followed by USB device activity. This sequence may indicate an attacker attempting to establish persistence mechanisms while potentially transferring data to removable media.

rule.description: cross-correlation: Potential "Ajax Security Team" APT attack detected.
rule.info: 111670: Fortigate: Outbound RDP connection successfull. 106788: OAT: AJAX APT attack sequence from phishing to code execution. Description: This correlation rule identifies a sophisticated attack pattern matching AJAX APT's typical sequence: initial compromise through phishing, followed by malicious code execution, and subsequent remote access attempts. This chain of events strongly indicates post-exploitation activity.
